definition: a period of time/phase/stage/classifier for issues of a periodical, courses of study/time/term/period/to hope/Taiwan pr. [qi2]
to defer payment/to pay back over long term

sentences.english: It rained， therefore the football match was put off.
sentences.chinese: 天下雨，所以足球比赛延期了。

sentences.english: He compounded with his creditor for a postponement of payment.
sentences.chinese: 他与债权人达成协定延期付款。

sentences.english: The bill also includes one-year extension of tax credits of ethanol industry policy .
sentences.chinese: 该法案也包括将乙醇行业的税收抵减政策延期一年。

sentences.english: and note with due attention your request
sentences.chinese: 也及时注意到你们延期付款的请求。

sentences.english: There is something urgent. Could we put off our date?
sentences.chinese: 发生了一些急事。我俩的约会能不能延期？

sentences.english: We are not tabling the problem to the time of furtIT notice.
sentences.chinese: 咱们延期谈论这件事，以后再说。

sentences.english: Abe succeeded in having it extended last year.
sentences.chinese: 安倍成功的使其在去年得以延期。

sentences.english: In case of emergency, each student has a single one day extension on a draft or revision that she or he can take.
sentences.chinese: 有突发情况时，每人只能延期一天提交草稿或修改稿。

sentences.english: Stay behind must also extend the package duration.
sentences.chinese: 延期停留须同时延长套票晚数。

sentences.english: We ca am #39;t accept payment on deferred terms.
sentences.chinese: 我们不能接受延期付款。
第三十条子项目延期验收。

sentences.english: We are tabling this matter until further notice.
sentences.chinese: 我们延期讨论这事，以后再说。

sentences.english: Well, we offer an extended warranty and service contract for a reasonable charge.
sentences.chinese: 这个，我们以合理的收费提供延期保用和服务合同。

sentences.english: China's Minister of Agriculture Du Qinglin confirmed the extension.
sentences.chinese: 中国农业部长杜青林确认了延期一事。

sentences.english: In consequence of the bad weather, the sports-meeting was postponed.
sentences.chinese: 由于天气不好，运动会延期举行了。

sentences.english: The vehicle manufacturer suffers delays in the production of vehicles.
sentences.chinese: 这家汽车制造商存在汽车生产延期的问题。

definition: the end of fixed period in office/expiration of a term
to push back (progress, the times etc)
to be overdue/to fail to meet a deadline/to be behind in doing sth
to delay/to postpone/to keep putting sth off/to procrastinate/(computing) to lag
to cease/to suspend/to break off/to stop/to discontinue
to fall due (loan etc)/to expire (visa etc)/to mature (investment bond etc)
